bug.description:

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/MrRace>@MrRace</denchmark-link> thank you a lot for reporting this. Indeed, this doesn't appear to be the right behavior for the webserver:
When a post request with a malformed JSON is made, a 400 error code should be returned. Instead, it gets a 500. When the content-type is not set (i.e."Content-Type: "), your payload parameter should be a bytes object.
Also, when the user doesn't set the content-type for a curl request, curl will automatically set it to . This can explain why you are getting a object. I presume you were using the utility for this. Check this out: <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37718308/what-is-default-header-content-type-for-http-post-method-in-curl-form>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37718308/what-is-default-header-content-type-for-http-post-method-in-curl-form</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/MrRace>@MrRace</denchmark-link> we've created PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cortexlabs/cortex/pull/1212>#1212</denchmark-link> to address this problem.
